title: Ohms law - students graph I-over-V vs V

content.question: A resistor made from an ohmic material is connected to a variable power supply. A group of students measures the current <math alttext="I" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>I</mi></math> and the potential difference <math alttext="delta V" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">Δ</mi><mi>V</mi></math> for the resistor over a range of power supply settings. The students calculate the ratio of the current to the potential difference, and then make a graph of the quantity <math alttext="the fraction with numerator I, and denominator delta V" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mfrac><mi>I</mi><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">Δ</mi><mi>V</mi></mrow></mfrac></math> as a function of <math alttext="delta V" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">Δ</mi><mi>V</mi></math>. Which of the following graphs could be the students’ graph?

choices.label: The figure shows the graph of a line in the first quadrant of a coordinate plane with the origin labeled O. The horizontal axis is labeled delta V and the vertical axis is labeled the fraction I over delta V. No values are indicated on either axis. The line starts just to the right of the vertical axis, high above the horizontal axis, moves horizontally to the right, and ends near the end of the horizontal axis.

The figure shows the graph of a line in the first quadrant of a coordinate plane with the origin labeled O. The horizontal axis is labeled delta V and the vertical axis is labeled the fraction I over delta V. No values are indicated on either axis. The line starts close to the origin and moves up and to the right, ending near the end of the horizontal axis and far above it.

The figure shows the graph of a curve in the first quadrant of a coordinate plane with the origin labeled O. The horizontal axis is labeled delta V and the vertical axis is labeled the fraction I over delta V. No values are indicated on either axis. The curve begins close to the origin and continues up and to the right, with the slope getting steeper.

The figure shows the graph of a curve in the first quadrant of a coordinate plane with the origin labeled O. The horizontal axis is labeled delta V and the vertical axis is labeled the fraction I over delta V. No values are indicated on either axis. The curve begins just to the right of the vertical axis, high above the horizontal axis. The curve moves down and to the right, with the slope becoming less negative and the curve asymptotically approaching the horizontal axis.

content.answer: The figure shows the graph of a line in the first quadrant of a coordinate plane with the origin labeled O. The horizontal axis is labeled delta V and the vertical axis is labeled the fraction I over delta V. No values are indicated on either axis. The line starts just to the right of the vertical axis, high above the horizontal axis, moves horizontally to the right, and ends near the end of the horizontal axis.

skill.text: 3.B: Apply an appropriate law, definition, theoretical relationship, or model to make a claim.
